uk.ac.soton.simulation.jsit.core

Class DistNegativeBinomial

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.soton.simulation.jsit.core.AbstractStochasticItem
      • uk.ac.soton.simulation.jsit.core.Distribution
        • uk.ac.soton.simulation.jsit.core.DistributionDiscrete
          • uk.ac.soton.simulation.jsit.core.DistNegativeBinomial
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class DistNegativeBinomial
extends DistributionDiscrete
implements java.io.Serializable
    JSIT representation of a negative binomial distribution. This uses the formulation as in most statistical definitions (e.g., Wolfram Math World, atRisk) where it gives the number of failures before n successes in a sequence of independent trials, each with probability of success p.

    Compare this to Wikipedia's definition, where it is the number of successes before r failures.

    Since:
    0.2
    Author:
    Stuart Rossiter
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
